alert.note: Alert for Morris; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:21AM EST until January 11 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey, including the following counties, Hunterdon, Morris and Warren. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 819 AM EST, flooding was ongoing across portions of the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. This is a new warning for the Musconetcong with reports of flooding further upstream in Hackettstown. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - For Musconetcong River at Bloomsbury: At 8:15am the stage was 6.88 feet. Flood Stage is 6 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
